MEDIAN_AGE: positive as beta sign but huge std error, relatively high p-value and large confidence interval
T_STAT: (sample mean-popilation mean)/(sample standard deviation/square root(sample size))
P_VALUE:
this p-value is too high : the null hypothesis cannot be excluded as it is way above 0.05.
It means it is not statistically significant neither at 95% confidence interval, nor at 90%.
INCREASE:
According to this model, holding all other factor constant, increasing share of families with a married couple
by 1 percent in the district decreases the number of incidents by 2 115.
LIMITATIONS:
We cannot rely on R-square because we did not check the residuals and we have several factors with p-values way 
too high. An explanation is that we have not selected independant variables (for example 'perc less than high school' is highly 
corrrelated/redundant with 'perc college graduates') so we cannot trust this model.
